content:
HiCAR - Chromatin Accessibility and Interaction Analysis

Analyzes HiCAR (HiC on Accessible Regulatory DNA) data for simultaneous measurement of chromatin accessibility and cis-regulatory chromatin contacts. Unlike immunoprecipitation-based methods, HiCAR does not require antibodies.

What is HiCAR?

HiCAR uses Transposase-Accessible Chromatin to anchor chromatin interactions, enabling researchers to study enhancer-promoter loops and regulatory networks without antibody requirements.

Key Features

  • Antibody-Free: No immunoprecipitation required
  • Multi-Omic Support: Handles HiCAR, HiChIP, ChIA-PET, PLAC-Seq
  • Low Input Compatible: Works with limited sample material
  • Comprehensive Analysis: From reads to interaction loops
  • Extensive Visualization: Cooler, .hic, circos plots

Pipeline Workflow

  1. Quality Control: Read QC with FastQC
  2. Read Mapping: Align to reference genome
  3. Peak Calling: Identify accessible chromatin regions
  4. Loop Detection: Find genomic interaction loops
  5. Differential Analysis: Compare conditions
  6. Visualization: Generate interaction maps

Scientific Applications

  • Enhancer-Promoter Loops: Map regulatory interactions
  • Gene Regulation: Understand transcriptional control
  • 3D Genome Architecture: Study chromatin organization
  • Disease Mechanisms: Identify disrupted regulatory networks
  • Development Studies: Track chromatin changes during differentiation

Advantages Over Traditional Methods

  • No Antibodies Required: Reduces cost and experimental complexity
  • Dual Information: Accessibility + interactions in one experiment
  • Universal Application: Works across cell types and organisms
  • Low Input: Suitable for limited samples

Input Requirements

  • FASTQ Files: Paired-end sequencing data
  • Sample Sheet: CSV with sample information
  • Reference Genome: FASTA and annotations
  • Optional: Mappability file for improved analysis

Main Outputs

  • Interaction Loops: Enhancer-promoter connections
  • Peak Files: Accessible chromatin regions
  • Visualization Files: Cooler, .hic, circos plots
  • QC Reports: Comprehensive MultiQC report
  • Differential Results: Condition-specific interactions

Perfect for: Enhancer-Promoter Mapping • Gene Regulation • 3D Genome • Chromatin Interactions • Low-Input Experiments
